intro: Muscarella llamachoi, commonly known as the Andean muscaria, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, blade-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or pale blue in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine soils. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
